Download Videos From YouTube

Posted by Vipin Kumar on October 16, 2019 · 3 mins read
I was searching for an easy way to download YouTube videos from the Linux command line and I found youtube-dl command but I had to download each video individually. Now, I wanted something that could download a list of videos. For that, I came up with a bash script that could take a file as input containing the video URLs. First, let's get started with installing youtube-dl. # STEP 1: INSTALLING YOUTUBE-DL If you get an error like above, use the below command. After downloading the script, set the executable permission. Now, let's verify if the youtube-dl command works, If you get output from the above command, it's fine. Else, you have to copy/move the script file to /bin directory. Verify again if the "youtube-dl -h" command works and hope it would work as it did for me. # STEP 2: CREATE BASH SCRIPT Now that we have installed the youtube-dl, let's create a bash script that will take input from a file. Save the script. I saved it as "demo.sh". That's it. Our script is ready now, but we are not finished yet. # STEP 3: CREATE A FILE WITH VIDEO URLs The final step would be creating a simple file that contains video URLs. Make sure each video URL is in separate lines. Save the file with any name you want. For example, I saved the file as a video list. # STEP 4: EXECUTE THE SCRIPT Finally, we are ready to download the list of videos in single command from youtube. ./demo -- This is our script videolist -- Our file containing list of videos < -- This is STDIN i.e we are giving the file as input for our script. That's it.. :)
